intro: Cyclanthera quinquelobata, commonly known as the five-lobed cucumber, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces elongated, pale green fruits that are typically 15–30 cm in length. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with five distinct lobes, giving it its scientific name. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant.
